back.text:
Root: ع د و (ʿ-D-W)
Meaning: By the charging horses
Pronunciation: Wal-ʿĀdiyāt
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'عَا'.
Derived Words:
1. عَدْو (ʿAdw): Running, charge
2. عَدَاء (ʿAdā'): Enmity
3. عَدُوّ (ʿAdūw): Enemy
Example Ayah: وَالْعَادِيَاتِ ضَبْحًا

hint.text: The first word of the Surah, an oath by the galloping horses.

back.text:
Root: ض ب ح (Ḍ-B-Ḥ)
Meaning: Panting (sound of fast horses)
Pronunciation: Ḍabḥan
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation, **Qalqalah** on the 'ب'.
Derived Words: This noun is unique to this verse in the Quran.
Example Ayah: وَالْعَادِيَاتِ ضَبْحًا

hint.text: The heavy breathing of the running horses.

back.text:
Root: و ر ي (W-R-Y)
Meaning: Those that kindle fire, striking sparks
Pronunciation: Al-Mūriyāt
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah**, **Madd Tabi'i** on 'مُو' and 'يَا'.
Derived Words:
1. إِيرَاء (Īrā'): Igniting
2. وَرَى (Warā): To produce fire by striking
Example Ayah: فَالْمُورِيَاتِ قَدْحًا

hint.text: The sparks that fly from the horses' hooves.

back.text:
Root: ك ن د (K-N-D)
Meaning: Extremely ungrateful
Pronunciation: Lakanūd
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'نُو'.
Derived Words:
1. كَنَد (Kanad): Ingratitude
2. كَنُود (Kanūd): Ungrateful person
Example Ayah: إِنَّ الْإِنسَانَ لِرَبِّهِ لَكَنُودٌ

hint.text: Describes mankind's ingratitude to his Lord.

back.text:
Root: ش ه د (Sh-H-D)
Meaning: Surely a witness
Pronunciation: Lashahīd
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'هِ'.
Derived Words:
1. شَهِيد (Shahīd): Witness, martyr
2. شَهَادَة (Shahādah): Testimony
Example Ayah: وَكَفَىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهِيدًا

hint.text: Mankind is a witness against himself.

back.text:
Root: خ ي ر (Kh-Y-R)
Meaning: Good, wealth
Pronunciation: Al-Khayr
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Layyin** on the 'خَيْ'.
Derived Words:
1. خَيْر (Khayr): Goodness, better
2. أَخْيَار (Akhyār): The good ones
Example Ayah: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُ

hint.text: Refers to worldly wealth and possessions mankind loves.

back.text:
Root: ق ب ر (Q-B-R)
Meaning: The graves
Pronunciation: Al-Qubūr
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'بُو'.
Derived Words:
1. قَبْر (Qabr): A grave
2. مَقْبُور (Maqbūr): Buried one
Example Ayah: أَفَلَا يَعْلَمُ إِذَا بُعْثِرَ مَا فِي الْقُبُورِ

hint.text: Where the dead are buried before resurrection.

back.text:
Root: ص د ر (Ṣ-D-R)
Meaning: The chests, hearts
Pronunciation: Aṣ-Ṣudūr
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Shamsiyyah**, **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'دُو'.
Derived Words:
1. صَدْر (Ṣadr): Chest
2. تَصْدِير (Taṣdīr): Bringing forth
Example Ayah: وَحُصِّلَ مَا فِي الصُّدُورِ

hint.text: The hidden thoughts that will be exposed.

back.text:
Root: خ ب ر (Kh-B-R)
Meaning: Fully aware
Pronunciation: Lakhabīr
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'بِي'.
Derived Words:
1. خَبِير (Khabīr): All-aware
2. خَبَر (Khabar): News, information
Example Ayah: وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ

hint.text: A divine attribute of Allah’s complete knowledge.
